image.altText: A pontoon off a reef in Cairns.

props.synopsis: The South Australian man, who was found unresponsive while snorkelling, was pulled out of the water, but attempts to revive him were unsuccessful.

title.children: Investigations launched into death of man on Great Barrier Reef snorkelling tour

image.altText: premier annastacia palaszczuk stands at a press conference with her arms folded and a serious expression

props.synopsis: In the sunshine state, councils have ultimate authority over whether there's fluoride in their water supply. Some say it's too expensive, others are wary of anti-fluoride campaigners.

title.children: This simple public health policy has been adopted by most of Australia. Queensland's premier has ruled it out

image.altText: Ambulances in emergency driveway at Ipswich hospital, west of Brisbane

props.synopsis: Health Minister Shannon Fentiman met with emergency department heads today to discuss ways to address ambulance ramping, with the premier saying a lack of GPs is adding to the pressure on hospitals.

title.children: Roundtable held over Queensland ramping crisis as patients wait almost 10 hours for emergency bed

image.altText: HMAS Toowoomba

props.synopsis: Taiwan's defence ministry said an Australian ship, understood to be the HMAS Toowoomba, has sailed through the strategic waterway, after its personnel were injured by a Chinese sonar pulse.

title.children: Australian warship confronted by Chinese navy last week transits sensitive Taiwan Strait

image.altText: Bruce Lehrmann arrives with coffee at the Federal Court.

props.synopsis: Bruce Lehrmann is suing Network Ten and Lisa Wilkinson over coverage in which Brittany Higgins alleged she was raped in Parliament House in 2019.

title.children: 'I was wrong': Bruce Lehrmann concedes he bought drinks for Brittany Higgins despite earlier saying he couldn't recall

image.altText: An aerial shot of a destroyed farm property

props.synopsis: The bushfire emergency that has caused widespread destruction to homes and infrastructure in Perth's north-east continues as an unseasonal heatwave rolls into a fourth day. Follow live.

title.children: Fears more homes lost as aerial photos lay bare ferocious Perth bushfire's path of destruction

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Live updates begin from fire authorities

image.altText: Photo of older woman with short hair standing behind open door with living room behind her

props.synopsis: Pensioner Gail Couchman was living on an old bus before she found an affordable rental home thanks to the efforts of her local Lions Club.

title.children: The town where pensioners can rent new units for $200 per week

image.altText: GPS tracker on an ankle with person wearing a black shoe.

props.synopsis: Electronic ankle bracelets have so far failed to prevent youth reoffending, Queensland police documents reveal.

title.children: Ankle bracelets failing to prevent youth crime, police documents show

image.altText: Peter Dutton in the prime minister's courtyard

props.synopsis: Federal Opposition Leader Peter Dutton raised the prospect of a "catastrophic outcome" as the result of Palestinians receiving visitor visas to come to Australia amid the Israel-Gaza war.

title.children: Peter Dutton links visas for Palestinians with prospect of a 'catastrophic outcome' for Australia

image.altText: A view at Howard Springs as staff prepare for evacuation.

props.synopsis: Coroner Elisabeth Armitage will investigate the deaths of three people who had been detained in Australia's "gold standard" quarantine facility during the COVID-19 pandemic. She will consider the quality of care at the centre as well as the legalities around mandatory quarantine.

title.children: Coroner to probe deaths of three people held at Howard Springs COVID facility

image.altText: People stand around collapsed building

props.synopsis: The Indonesian hospital in Gaza City is under heavy fire as it operates without light, Palestinian health officials say. Follow live.

title.children: Indonesian hospital under heavy fire, Gaza health officials say

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Troops will stay behind ceasefire line in Gaza
School strikes for Palestinians continue today in Sydney

image.altText: A plume of smoke rises above a city dotted with buildings.

props.synopsis: As part of a temporary ceasefire deal that is due to begin as early as today, Hamas will begin releasing Israeli hostages in exchange for Palestinian prisoners. But with thousands more remaining in detention inside Israel and hundreds of captives in Gaza, there is still a long way to go.

title.children: These are some of the Palestinian prisoners who could be released as part of the Israel-Gaza hostage deal

image.altText: An older man wearing a shirt

props.synopsis: The disgraced former minister is sentenced to a non-parole period of 13 years for sexually abusing four boys between 1993 and 2003.

title.children: 'Calculated, predatory': Former NSW Labor MP Milton Orkopoulos jailed for 20 years over child sexual abuse

image.altText: University student Sophy Barlow has trouble accessing her classes

props.synopsis: Following COVID lockdowns, it's clear flexible study works. So why aren't universities taking a "more proactive approach" to ensure people of all abilities can access higher education?

title.children: Sophy missed out on two of her uni classes because there was no way for her to get into the room

image.altText: Father and daughter pose next to broken cyclone wire.

props.synopsis: When three-year-old Sophia was stabbed in the eye by a stray piece of fence wiring while walking along a footpath, her father Kain asked the local council and rail company if they could fix the fence. But both authorities said the fence belonged to the other.

title.children: After his daughter was injured by a 'dangerous' fence, Kain couldn't get the authorities to say who owns it

image.altText: A man wearing a wide-brim hat walks into a police station to report for bail.

props.synopsis: A 57-year-old man on trial in a Kalgoorlie court has taken the witness stand and detailed his version of how he came into possession of a stolen firearm he used to shoot another man in the stomach.

title.children: 'Maybe I got it wrong' says accused gunman on witness stand in outback shooting trial

image.altText: A waste bin and a recycling bin sit on the kerbside of a leafy suburb.

props.synopsis: An extra 5,290 Brisbane homes will have to access to food waste recycling services from February next year, as the council expands the initiative to several new suburbs.

title.children: Food waste recycling service rolled out to thousands more Brisbane households

image.altText: A head shot of a dark-skinned man

props.synopsis: A former basketballer who inflicted catastrophic head injuries on a Perth mother of five fails to convince a Supreme Court judge he is not guilty of murder.

title.children: Judge rejects former basketballer's claim he was not of sound mind when he bludgeoned partner to death

image.altText: A bright pink Telstra van with the words "Australia's largest regional network" on the side, driving in a remote area.

props.synopsis: Telstra's "pink bus" travels to remote communities to help Indigenous clients, but financial counsellors have concerns the outreach service is not helping victims of mis-selling get the compensation they're entitled to.

title.children: Telstra's pink bus waived a woman's debt. Later, she found out she was also entitled to $12,000

image.altText: Probiotic variety

props.synopsis: Probiotics that fill supermarket shelves promise to boost your digestion and immune system. Some even claim they can help people with an irritable bowel or low mood. Let's look at the evidence.

title.children: Yoghurt vs probiotics. Which is better for restoring that good gut bacteria?

image.altText: Julia Garner and Jessica Henwick squint in the outback, wearing huge backpacks, in the film The Royal Hotel.

props.synopsis: The Royal Hotel probes the darker side of masculinity as magnified by a remote outback setting and alcohol consumption on a liver-defying scale — and evokes the spectre of horror without ever actually letting it loose.

title.children: 'Gonna have to be OK with male attention': Australian drinking culture through the eyes of two outsiders

image.altText: A person holds an iPhone with the banking apps for ANZ, Commonwealth Bank, NAB and Westpac open.

props.synopsis: Australia's banks will announce a joint effort to tackle a rise in scams and prevent customers from being victims of cybercrime, while the local share market is trading slightly higher after Thanksgiving saw Wall Street closed overnight. Follow live.

title.children: Australian banks join forces to tackle rise in scams, ASX inches higher after Thanksgiving shuts Wall Street

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Why oil prices are experiencing their own personal roller-coaster
Disrupt, detect, respond: Banks unveil 'new offensive in the war on scams'
'Sobering nowcast' of Australian economy as higher rates bite

image.altText: A close-up photo of a women holding her toddler, while the toddler smiles

props.synopsis: As a Productivity Commission report notes the problems behind Australia's childcare crisis, these small-town families say solutions can't come quickly enough.

title.children: We need action now, say parents in childcare black spots as new report flags fixes

image.altText: A woman in a red dress and a man kissing under a flowery arbor.

props.synopsis: A wedding celebrant has hatched a one-of-a-kind fundraiser — marrying four couples in one afternoon, with a hair, make up and photography package for the budget price of less than $1,000.

title.children: Why four couples got married at the same venue on the same afternoon

image.altText: Children on a roof drop a bucket of water on children standing on a suburban street in the middle of the day

props.synopsis: Last week, the planet appeared to briefly breach a climate threshold set by world governments for the first time. Experts say it is just another sign of how much the planet is warming.

title.children: Earth briefly surpassed a crucial temperature milestone last week. Experts say there's more to be worried about

image.altText: Rain clouds over Wattamondara

props.synopsis: Rain is falling onto dry farms, dry gardens and empty water tanks, much to the relief of farmers and firefighters after a very dry couple of months.

title.children: Widespread severe storms continue into weekend, dumping heavy rain on drought stricken areas

image.altText: A man on the roof of a burning skyrise has a crane cage landing next to him

props.synopsis: A crane operator plays down tributes paid to him after he lifted a man to safety from a burning high-rise building in England.

title.children: Crane operator rescues man from roof of burning high-rise in England

image.altText: A composite image of three men in suits.

props.synopsis: Forty one days after the election, New Zealand has announced a deal that will see the country led by a three-party coalition government.

title.children: Deputy PM role to be shared as NZ reaches coalition agreement

image.altText: People wearing masks sit in a crowded hospital waiting room.

props.synopsis: Chinese health authorities have provided data requested by the World Health Organisation (WHO) on an increase in respiratory illnesses and reported clusters of pneumonia in children.

title.children: Leading scientists urge caution over new pandemic fears amid pneumonia clusters in China

image.altText: a man wearing glassed stands next to a flag looking sideways

props.synopsis: The government says it has agreed to 'all 56' of the Robodebt royal commission's recommendations. So then why does the report list the number as 57?

title.children: We fact checked Mark Dreyfus on the Robodebt royal commission recommendations. Here's what we found

image.altText: A young boy wears a rash top and bandana at the beach on a bright day with cloud.

props.synopsis: A Victorian coroner hands down damning findings after an investigation into the death of six-year-old Eugene Mahauariki, who fell from an Easter carnival ride in 2017.

title.children: Six-year-old boy's death on Rye carnival ride was clearly preventable, coroner finds

image.altText: A man in hospital, hooked up to drips, with shut eyes

props.synopsis: A snake catcher in north-west Victoria says he was so busy he did not realise a highly venomous reptile had bitten him on the finger. Then he started to lose consciousness.

title.children: 'Overworked' snake catcher collapses after he was bitten and didn't know it

image.altText: Two women smile at the camera with greenery behind

props.synopsis: Fifteen years after a tsunami engulfed Samoa's shores there are still the telltale signs of entire reefs and coral beds that washed away. Tapping into the knowledge of fellow Indigenous leaders is sparking hopes for their restoration.

title.children: After facing a 22m-high tsunami, Christina joins other Pacific traditional owners working to restore battered reefs
